title: Switch site background from black/dark to white for improved readability

requirements.text: Force the site to render in the light theme so the global background is white (not dark/black), regardless of the userâ€™s system theme settings.

quotes: Unfortunately, the (black) background is too-too hard to read. Instead, make the background (white).

acceptanceCriteria: On a device/browser set to dark mode, the app still renders with a light/white background.
The root page background (body/app shell) appears white/light rather than black/dark across all routes (normal, payment success, payment failure, loading state).

requirements.text: Update any explicitly dark UI surfaces that conflict with the new white background so text remains highly readable, including the Header brand pill/button background and the Hero intro text container background.

quotes: the (black) background is too-too hard to read. Instead, make the background (white).

acceptanceCriteria: The Header brand area no longer uses a black background that reduces readability against the white/light page (e.g., replace with a light/neutral surface using existing theme tokens).
The Hero intro text block (neon green bordered box) uses a light/white (or very light) fill so the paragraph text is easy to read on the white-themed page.
Text contrast meets a clearly readable standard in the Hero intro block, Header, and other primary copy areas (no dark-on-dark or low-contrast combinations introduced by the theme switch).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only components).
Keep the existing React + Tailwind + Shadcn + React Query stack; no new frameworks or external styling libraries.
nonGoals: Do not change backend behavior, schemas, or data catalogs.
Do not redesign layout or change content/wording of existing sections beyond what is needed to improve readability under a white background.
